body_content.explanation: able to see, hear, or recognize small differences between things :
examples: The fine sensory discriminative ability of the fingers enables the blind to read braille.
This study aims to evaluate the discriminative power of three widely-used assessment scales.

body_content.explanation: treating a person or group of people differently, especially in an unfair way:
examples: Unions described the move as discriminative.
There was a backlash from those who thought the decision was discriminative.
